revision.text:
{{wiktionary|ABM}} '''ABM''' or '''Abm''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==Companies== * [[ABM Industries]], an American corporation * [[ABM United Kingdom Limited]], a United Kingdom software company * [[Advantage Business Media]], a private American company * [[Pressed Metal Corporation South Australia|Australian Bus Manufacturers]], a former Australian bus manufacturer * Associated British Maltsters, a malting company taken over by [[Dalgety plc]]
==Computing== * [[Advanced Bit Manipulation]], an instruction set extension for x86 * [[Agent-based model]], a specific individual-based computational model for computer simulation * [[Asynchronous Balanced Mode]], a communication mode of HDLC and derivative protocols
==Military== * [[Anti-ballistic missile]], missile systems designed to counter ballistic missiles * [[Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty]], a treaty between the United States and USSR * [[Air Battle Manager]], a rated flying position in the US Air Force
==Other== * [[Automated banking machine]], dialectical term for automated teller machine * [[ABM (video game)|''ABM'' (video game)]], a 1980 game for the Apple II * [[Abanyom language]], a Niger-Congo language of Nigeria * [[Abertawe Bro Morgannwg University Health Board]], an NHS Trust in Wales * [[Account-based marketing]], a targeted approach to marketing to a key account * [[Activity-based management]], a strategic decision-making method * [[Meningitis|Acute Bacterial Meningitis]], commonly referred to as ABM when caused by bacterial pathogens * [[Agaricus Blazei Murill]], a Brazilian mushroom * [[Abahlali baseMjondolo]], movement of South African shack dwellers * [[Ansar Bait al-Maqdis]], an Egyptian militant organization * [[Antique Boat Museum]], a museum in Clayton, New York, United States * [[Northern Peninsula Airport]], in Queensland, Australia (IATA airport code) ( [[Alex Beaulieu-Marchand]] (born 1994), Canadian skier
{{disambiguation}}
